Author: henning
Content:
you're like the wall street people he talks with. they don't get him, either. did you ever consider that maybe the reason craigslist was so successful was that it didn't have annoying banner ads or a login screen everywhere the way standard Valley dogma bullshit demands?

he DOES want to do more with craigslist. he talked about this in an interview with Charlie Rose. he said that craigslist is focused on very basic needs -- finding a job, finding a place to live, etc. he wants to extend that to bigger and better things. doing that is hard and it takes time.

Author: henning
Content:
How to write tech blog linkbait:

1. Get a rumor with even the slightest shred of evidence that would be outrageous if true.

2. After the links start pouring in, "update" with a "correction" that your unsubstantiated bullshit rumor is false, surprise surprise.

3. Profit? Fuck yeah, profit.

Author: rms
Content:
Yeah, it's a really bad idea to post an unregistered domain name in a public forum. Grab it right now, you can get the .net and .org later.

www.namecheap.com is my registrar of choice, $8.88 a year with free WhoisGuard (anonymizes your whois information in a way that won't allow someone to steal your domain).

Author: chaostheory
Content:
b/c if you don't grab it now (unless you were thinking to launching with a different name) someone else will grab it (especially if there's a jerk reading your post on yc news - hopefully not)

Being open with ideas is fine, b/c execution of an idea is hard (even with "easy" ideas). Grabbing a domain name or even trademarking a name is a lot easier.

Author: rms
Content: The iPod had a 1.8" hard drive when all the competitive MP3 players had a 2.5" hard drive, making them twice as large. People seem to forget how much smaller the iPod was compared to all the other hard drive MP3 players, I think this is the real reason it won.
